reviews.review_msg: Sara was awesome, are you kidding me!!! The material was preety simple stuff and preety interesting, just memorize the stuff and you will ace it like i did! got an A-, and will def take her advanced class no doubt..plus you just need to ask and she wll clarify!

Is she even human? She is not a very approchable in her demeanor. As well,she goes very fast in her lecture notes so you MUST bring a laptop to write all the notes down because it will be impossible to write them all down my hand. The final exam she gives 64 questions to memorize and the format is short answer and one essay.

Cyber crime course is not as interesting as the description makes it to be. Boring lecture, and Smyth seems to have a cold demeanor when lecturing, once singling out a student for laughing/smiling. That being said, easy to gain marks in tutorial.

Maybe it's that's she's new to SFU, but whatever it is, she's really boring to listen to.  She almost talks to you like you're really young.  She goes over the same thing again and again and you really don't learn anything new.  It sounds a lot cooler than it actually is I found.

Best criminology prof. If you go to all the lectures and write down everything she says, you will get a really good grade on the exams which are takehome exams and she gave us 3 days to do them. Amazing prof.

Best prof I've ever had. Super passionate and is very clear/well-spoken. Gives lots of good examples to help understand content. Advice - go to lecture and write down everything said. Exams are almost all lecture based, so if you go, take notes, and pay attention, it's easy to do well.

Good professor overall. There's a group project that's a presentation. Online homework is time-consuming. Tutorials are a must, and you have to participate if you want full marks. Does not post slides to canvas, and exams are lecture heavy, so lecture attendance is important. Term paper was easy to write (easy steps to follow). No textbook!

did not vibe with this prof at all, very old fashioned, and inspires very little. she is not open to students feedback, and her TA is just as useless as her, would never take this prof again despite earning a good mark.

One of the best lecturers at SFU. Clear slides and informative lectures, explains concepts so well you have no problem understanding the material. Exams are short-answer questions, but open-book, with all recordings of lectures available. Definitely recommend.

She is a solid prof. I have taken her a couple of times now and I found her to be fair and reasonable. One suggestion I have is to focus on what she talks about in lectures and the examples she gives.
She's overrated.
I don't like group projects but this was the one time where it was okay because we got to make our own groups. Great prof and hope she teaches more classes
Would take a course with Vienna again.
An angel. Take her class

i LOVE going to Viennas class. I am at sfu 8am-7pm and my last lecture is with her, i ALWAYS look forward to it. no matter how tired i am. I absolutely love her and wish i could take every one of her classes

Vienna is the most caring professor I have had at SFU. I had never taken a forensics class before, but she made sure the content was accessible and always encouraged questions. It's clear that she truly cares about her students' success and wellbeing. If you want a high grade in her class, she will support you in getting one.

Vienna is very nice and I admire her passion and dedication to the content and students. That being said, the assignment criteria was not very clear and resulted in some pretty poor marks (you have to read between the lines). The content is very scientific/medical which can be pretty difficult. Overall it was a good class, not my favorite though.

I really enjoyed taking this class with Vienna in Fall 2022, especially with how the materials were delivered. It was interesting how that term's avg was a B+ seeing how the norm is usually a B-/B. Lectures are straightforward, however, I believe that the first assignment could use a bit more instruction as it was a bit vague. Highly recommend!

The final was a take home group project. My friends that took the course last time said it was a take home that they had to do individually so it seems like it can change semester to semester. The class was interesting and the infographic assignment was fun. No papers and big exams.
Vienna really cared about students during the pandemic and makes super interesting lectures. She brings a ton of guest lectures and is open to emails and questions a ton!

Dr. Lam was very supportive during this pandemic. I hope more professors cared about our mental health and well-being. The class itself is interesting but the readings were boring. I wished the lectures were longer so there would be less of a focus on the readings for the quizzes.

Vienna was very nice and seemed to care about her student's success. She gave two opportunities fro bonus marks which was awesome. She had a lot of guest lecture which is cool if your are interested in under water investigations. Only negative was that her assignment criteria was pretty hard to understand and a lot of students had questions.

Incredibly sweet woman with a lot of knowledge in her field. I've had Jodie as both a TA and prof and considerable her one of the best. Super approachable and clear of her expectations! Respects her students and genuinely wants them to succeed. Would recommend a million times over!

Creates a class that is mostly based off of 3 papers but does not create guidelines on what constitutes a good mark vs a bad one. Marking is very up in the air and you don't really know why you are left with such a mark. Got a much higher mark than I thought on one of the papers but much lower on the ones I thought I did well. I can't believe it
Logan is a great prof, grading is a little strict but if you talk to him about any concerns you have, he will take the time to review and discuss it more in depth.

Professor Macnair is one of the newish profs at SFU. And he is excellent as a seminar professor. He is highly knowledgeable about the subject matter and succinct in his lectures--and a highly skilled and open-minded mediator in discussions. Attending lecture was always a pleasure. Great assignments too!
